text.Hello and welcome to the GNaP graphical: Hello and welcome to the GNaP graphical charter which contains rules regarding the graphic identity of GNaP for usage within GNaP developed (web) applications. It guarantees consistency across applications by defining the overall graphics, iconography, typography and ergonomic guidelines that should be followed.
text.In here you will find commonly used grap: In here you will find commonly used graphical elements for usage within your (web) application. It has been organised as follows:
text.Showcases a collection of commonly used: Showcases a collection of commonly used controls including Buttons, Progress Bar, Alerts, Pagination, Icons, Labels, Tables, Sections, Notifications and Form controls.
text.Illustrates all possible text styles, li: Illustrates all possible text styles, lists and other font related information.
text.Shows the error page to use in case of a: Shows the error page to use in case of an application error.
text.Presents a login page in case your proje: Presents a login page in case your project does not use Windows Integrated Authentication.
text.Exposes an example to demonstrate nestin: Exposes an example to demonstrate nesting of menu items.
text.With an approach aimed at crafting this: With an approach aimed at crafting this theme to provide an optimal viewing experience - easy reading and navigation with a minimum of resizing, panning and scrolling - across a wide range of devices (from smart phones via tablets to more classical computers), we can call it truly responsive.
text.In case you need one or more interface e: In case you need one or more interface elements which are not present in this graphical charter, you can
